title: Url Shortner
description: Created a URL shortening service that allows users to convert long URLs into shortened versions, similar to services like Bitly or TinyURL.
detailed_description: The project aimed to learn URL encoding/decoding techniques, work with databases for mapping original and shortened URLs, and implement redirection mechanisms.
usage: Users can submit a long URL, and the service generates a unique shortened link that redirects to the original URL when accessed.

title: Header Parser
description: Developed a microservice that parses HTTP headers from incoming requests, providing detailed information about the client's IP address, language, and software.
detailed_description: The primary goal was to gain hands-on experience with request manipulation and API development, while building a practical tool for understanding request metadata.
usage: The parser follows this process: it extracts the headers, formats them, and returns a JSON response with relevant data about the request source.

title: Time Stamp Microservice
description: Built a microservice that converts natural language date inputs into Unix timestamps and formatted date strings.
detailed_description: This project was an exercise in working with date formats, parsing user input, and generating responses that are universally understandable across different systems.
usage: The microservice processes requests by detecting the date format, converting it into a standard format, and returning the unique timestamp and UTC string.

title: MIT Scratch Clone
description: Developed a simplified version of MIT's Scratch programming platform.
detailed_description: sers can move around the svg image and rotate it and then continue to move it around, providing an engaging way to learn basic coding concepts visually.
usage: The task was challenging as the code execution is a step by step procedure but got a good hands on learning on How to work on svg images.
